item.description:
Blank-fest is an all day concert to benefit the homeless. Admission price is a blanket- just one you have around the house is fine- any condition.

Blank-fest was the brainchild of Kenn Rowell, the guy in front in the picture above. Each year he organizes a concert of local musicians. They do 1/2 hour sets starting at 12:00 PM and end around midnight, with Rowell's band the Baghdaddios going on last. Then, on Christmas Eve, he takes all the blankets and drives around Manhattan delivering blankets to homeless people on the street. It started out small 15 years ago, but more recently the concert nets blankets numbering in the hundreds.

It's hard for me to believe they're already on Blankfest 15. My first Blankfest was #2, I think. I realize this is a trek, so the plans may alter somewhat as we get closer to the date. If you're interested in carpooling, please e-mail me.

Hosted by Nyack's very own The Baghdaddios, the lineup is as follows so far:

Noon Open 2:00 PM Bob Newman 2:30 PM David W. Jacobsen 3:30 PM Tim O'Donohue Band 4:30 PM Kama Linden 5:00 PM Home To Henry 5:30 PM Jess King 6:00 PM Thucydean Theory 6:30 PM Rew 7:00 PM The Heshers 7:30 PM Patti Rothberg 8:00 PM Joe D'Urso 8:30 PM Frankie D. & The Boys 9:00 PM The Horse You Rode In On (until 10:00) 11:00 PM Johnny & The Alimonies 11:30 PM The Baghdaddios Midnight Show Ends


Here's a link to the concert flyer with a list of bands:

http://blankfest.org/

Here's a link to the Wikipedia page:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blank-Fest
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet somewhere and carpool or meet at the restaurant. I'll E-mail my cell phone number before the show.
item.name: BLANK-FEST It's about the homeless; nothing more, nothing less
